DOC.brief_summary: This three phase study design examine clinician behavior regard recommend prescribe pre-exposure prophylaxis ( PrEP ) primary Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) prevention strategy , identify knowledge-related attitudinal factor associate behavior . Each phase consist follow : Phase 1 : Semi-structured face-to-face telephone interview ATN-affiliated clinician . Approximately 10 clinician interview . Phase 2 : Development new theory-based survey instrument cognitive interview test survey . Approximately five clinician ( participated Phase 1 ) interview . Phase 3 : Administration newly develop survey ATN-affiliated clinician . Approximately 60 clinician interview .
DOC.brief_title: Clinician Attitudes Behaviors Regarding Use Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis ( PrEP ) Primary HIV Prevention
DOC.criteria: Clinicians ( include physician , nurse practitioner , physician assistant ) EITHER : Provide primary HIV care HIVinfected primary care HIVuninfected adolescent ; OR Provide primary HIV care HIVinfected adolescent ; Provides service adolescent young adult ATN sit one community partner ; Ability understand spoken English ; For Phase 2 : prior participation Phase 1 . Intoxicated influence alcohol substance time consent ; Visibly distraught and/or visibly emotionally unstable ( i.e. , exhibit suicidal , homicidal , violent behavior ) opinion protocol chair would interfere ability give true informed consent ; For Phase 3 : prior participation Phase 1 2 study .
